loans.name: Babycel

texts.en:
Babycel is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Babycel is successfully paying back her previous loan and now she's getting a new loan to improve her business.

NWTF is relisting Babycel's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en: Peter is a 53-year-old hardworking man with seven children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is a retail shop alongside farming to boost his income. He has a vision of developing his business and expanding it to new areas despite facing hardships of customers who delay payments. Peter will use the loan to buy stock like salt, sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell. He is a member of the above-mentioned group where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Syokau

texts.en:
Syokau is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past nine years, she has operated a food kiosk business selling food stuff such as maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the seasonality of high costs as her major challenge.  She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 loan she plans to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu in order to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 32 years-old and has two children.

Emerlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through Kiva partner NWTF in order to buy additional items including eggs, sugar, oil, rice, groceries, etc. to sell.

Emerlyn has borrowed and repaid 38 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming coconut.

She successfully paid back her previous loans and is now requesting an additional loan for her general store and farming coconut business.

Emerlyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items including eggs, sugar, oil, rice, groceries, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
La  señora  Elsa  de 43 años  de edad, vive en  su casa  con sus tres  hijos  que depende de ella, se dedica desde hace 15 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, frescos, cosméticos, granos básicos, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos, que ha diario le visitan.
Doña Elsa este negocio está ubicado en una buena zona, donde sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Elsa está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de  frescos, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, queso, café, pan, aguas, harina, huevos, leche y para su otro negocio cosméticos y sandalias, con el apoyo de este préstamo espera que su negocio crezca y le ayude a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Doña Elsa está solicitando su segundo préstamo y desea hacer un buen historial con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio y hacerlo crecer.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo  del 2013
texts.en:
Elsa, 43, lives in her own home with her 3 dependent children.  For 15 years, she has had a business selling groceries, drinks, cosmetics, and other staple consumer goods.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who visit her daily.

Elsa's business is located in a good area, and this is where she makes her sales every day.  She lives in a community in San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.

Elsa is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, beans, sugar, rice, cheese, coffee, bread, water, flour, eggs, and milk, and also to buy cosmetics and sandals.  With the support of this loan, she hopes that her business will grow, helping her to improve her family's quality of life.

Elsa is requesting her second loan, and she wants to have a good credit history with Prisma.  Her dream is to improve her business and make it grow.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May, 2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beans, sugar, rice, cheese, coffee, bread, water, flour, eggs, and milk for her business.

loans.name: Sherlyn

texts.en:
Sherlyn is 24 years old, single and works to help her parents.

Sherlyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of items to sell like toothbrushes, soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Sherlyn has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and earns additional income from raising livestock.

Sherlyn aspires to build and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like toothbrushes, soap, shampoo, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Benida

texts.en: Benida is 51 years old and has four school-aged children. She and her husband aim to improve their living conditions in order to continue sending their children to school. In this regard, Benida engages in the hog-raising business to generate income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she planned to acquire more piglets to raise, but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she is asking for additional capital of PHP 35,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She believes that her loan will be granted in order to make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

location.town: Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda. She previously borrowed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her family's personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her children will have good jobs. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 31 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school, Mylene works very hard to provide for them.

Mylene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to re-stock her store with canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

Mylene has been in this business for four years.

In the future, Mylene would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to re-stock her store with canned goods, soap, milk, sugar, spices, etc.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita, who works hard to support her family, is married and has been operating a general store business in the Philippines for 10 years now. She has requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as chips, canned goods, milk, soap, spices, etc.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like chips, canned goods, milk, soap, spices, etc

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose, a married woman blessed with children, rents a house that has electricity but not piped water. For the past two years, Rose has operated a food stall selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in her place of operation.

With this Kshs 50,000 loan, Rose wants to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en: Shabana is a 49-year-old diligent woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband and five children. Her husband has been running a school canteen for five years. Shabana, as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband would use the loan to purchase food supplies as the current stock in the canteen is almost finished. He would also do some repair work required in the canteen. This loan is very important for his business. Shabana is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. NOTE: In the picture, Shabana is raising her hand

loans.use: To purchase foodstuff to sell

loans.name: Sobia

texts.en: Sobia is a 28-year-old responsible housewife. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and child. Her husband is a laborer and he has a very low monthly income. Sobia has been selling hair dryers for two years. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new variety of hair dryers to increase her sales. She would spend the profit on the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase hair dryers

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila, a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a clothing sales business in the Philippines for five years, also earns income from farming rice. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF and is now borrowing PHP 14000 to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers.

Cirlia dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
This is Julie. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional stocks of medicine and mineral water to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a general merchandise store and this is where she is more focused.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items, toiletries, beverages and school and office supplies needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Julie dreams of expanding her networks and being more successful in her businesses. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, beverages, and school and office supplies to sell

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en: Kosar is a 48-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of eight children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband has a construction material supplies business. Kosar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase bricks, cement and other construction material and then sell it for a profit in the main market. By doing so, he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. Kosar is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to sell

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. Remedios is married and has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines.

Remedios requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional spices to sell.

Remedios has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Remedios would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her vending machine and to buy more iron roof needed in her business.

loans.name: Rifat

texts.en: Rifat is a 29-year-old independent woman. Her husband is a government employee but they are facing many problems in life due to his low salary. Rifat has been helping her husband by successfully running a tuition centre in her home for two years. Rifat has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase chairs and some required furniture for her tuition centre. She wants to construct one more room for her tuition centre as current space is very congested. In this way, she can teach more children and her monthly income could be increased. She would save the profit for a future purpose. She is very hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her.

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her tuition centre

loans.name: Jose Santos Silvano

texts.es:
José,  requiere de un nuevo préstamo  porque menciona que los créditos son una fuente favorable para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos para obtener ingresos económicos; este le permitirá comprar  cuatro quintales de abono y lo demás para el pago de mano de obra para limpiar la milpa. 
El crédito anterior le ayudo a obtener una cosecha de maíz más abundante y sana, ya que este le permitió invertirlo en los fertilizantes necesarios; las condiciones económicas han mejorado,  ya que  logro vender parte del maíz de la cosecha y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
José requires a new loan because he said credit is a favorable source to invest in basic grains to earn income. This will allow him to buy four quintals of fertilizer, and use the rest to hire labor to clean the cornfield.

The earlier loan helped him obtain a cleaner and more abundant corn crop, as this one will allow him to invest in necessary fertilizers. His economic condition has improved since he was able to sell some of the corn from his crop, and his family's circumstances have been optimized.

loans.use: to buy four quintals of fertilizer and pay labor.

loans.name: Jaznalyn

texts.en:
This is Jaznalyn. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped in their everyday life. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to cover her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Jaznalyn hopes that her store will be bigger. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Edna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and from her general store. Edna is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stock to sell to her customers.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more rice to stock and sell.

loans.name: Mernita

texts.en:
Mernita is 36 years old and married; she works very hard to help her husband earn a living.

Mernita runs a business buying and selling native products (bamboo mats used for house walls and ceilings) in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Mernita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Mernita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, de 37 años de edad, esta casado con lucia con quien tiene 2 hijos a quienes educa y cuida en su casa propia. El trabajo de Miguel, consiste en la construcción de puertas, ventanas, sillas de fierro. También se dedica a la venta de abarrotes. Lleva realizando está actividad un promedio de 07 años , anteriormente tenia el trabajo de soldador pero con el tiempo decidió poner su propio negocio en casa. Le va bien en su trabajo por está razón tiene una buena cartera de clientes que le permite tener buenas ganancias y mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy contento por el apoyo financiero recibido para salir adelante.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 soles, comprará varillas de fierro, varillas de soldar; para seguir realizando su trabajo y entregar los pedidos que tiene a tiempo.
texts.en:
Miguel, 37 years old, is married to Lucia with whom he has two children whom he educates and cares for in their own home. Miguel’s work consists of the construction of metal doors, windows and chairs. He also sells groceries, a business he has had an average of seven years. 

Formerly Miguel worked as a welder, however over time he decided to set up his own business in his home. His work is going well so that he has a good group of customers, which has allowed him to make good profits and improve his earnings. This is his first loan from Kiva and he is very pleased with the financial support received so that he can succeed. With the sum of S/. 500 requested, he will buy metal bars and soldering rods in order to continue doing his work and delivering his orders on time.

loans.use: to purchase metal and soldering rods.

loans.name: Yulchi

texts.ru: Юлчи мужчина среднего возраста. Родился и вырос в городе Канибадаме.    Женат и имеет четверых детей.   Его старший сын работает в Российской Федерации, а младшие после школы  помогает отцу в бизнесе.  Сам Юлчи работает в личном продуктовом магазине, в местном кишлаке.   В основном он покупает товар с рынков города Худжанда,но и поставщики приносят ему определенные продукты.   Также дополнительно   по ночам занимается услугами такси .   Юлчи сам человек по характеру очень активный,никогда без дело не сидит. Всегда чем -то занимается. И дома у него огромный сарай, там он занимается откормом скотов. Он и своих детей так воспитал. Его жена Мавлуда воспитает своих детей, а в свободное время помогает мужу. Они живут дружно и счастливо. Но увы на данный момент ему не хватает денег для развитие своего бизнеса.   Юлчи хочет закупить продукты питания.  Он обратился в организацию Арванд  за финансовой поддержкой и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Yulchi is a middle aged man, born and raised in Kanibadam. He is married and has four children. His eldest son works in Russia and his youngest helps his father in business after school. Yulchi works in his own grocery store, in a local village. He primarily buys products from the market in the town of Khujand, but vendors also bring him certain products. Additionally, he drives a taxi at night. 

Yulchi is a person with a very active personality, never without something to do. He is always busy with something. At home, he has a huge barn, where he fattens cattle. He raised his children to have the same outlook. His wife Mavluda raises the children and helps her husband in her free time. They live in harmony and happiness. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money at the moment to expand his business. Yulchi wants to purchase additional food products. He has approached Arvand for financial support and is hoping for a positive outcome.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Faizidin

texts.ru: Файзидин живет в районе Рудаки с женой и детьми. Ему 43 года. Он трудолюбивый и усердный человек, всегда старающийся улучшить условия жизни. Сейчас Файзидин собирается начать новую деятельность. Его интересует услуга маршрутного такси, так как он имеет опыт работы в этой сфере. Он планирует развозить пассажиров по маршрутной линии города Душанбе, где услугой такси пользуются почти все начиная от детей и заканчивая до пожилых людей. За счет деятельности он будет иметь хороший ежедневный доход. Файзидин продал свою одну корову на местном рынке. Однако ему не хватает денежной суммы в размере 2100 долларов США, чтобы закупить автомобиль. С этим намерением он запрашивает эту сумму в кредит. Файзидин верит, что его поддержат начать бизнес.
texts.en: Faizidin lives in the Rudaki region with his wife and children. He is 43 years old. He is an industrious and hard-working person, always striving to improve their living conditions. Faizidin is currently planning to start a new business. He is interested in shared taxi services, since he has work experience in this sector. He plans to drop off passengers along a route through Dushanbe, where almost everyone, from children to the elderly, use taxi services. According to his plan, he will have a good daily income. Faizadin sold his only cow on the local market. However, he needs an additional $2,100 USD to purchase a car. It is with this intention that he has applied for a loan in the same amount. Faizidin believes he will be supported in launching his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car to start his own business

loans.name: Danaya Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  membres du groupe DANAYA III sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Diassela, un des villages de la région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de micro finance Soro yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres de l’arachide, du mil et du haricot. Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, FAKOUMA OUSMANE  la première personne à gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 1.5 Ha de mil, d’arachide en association avec le haricot. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Beleco, après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice  de 120 000F CFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The 10 members of the DANAYA III group are married women. They are 37 years old on average and have an average of five children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Diassela, a village in the Koulikoro region, in the second administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they plant include peanuts, millet, and beans. This is their third collaboration with the institution.

With this new loan, FAKOUMA OUSMANE, the first person at left in the front row, would like to buy farm inputs, equipment, and plowing for 1.5 hectares of millet, peanuts, and beans. 

After the harvest, they sell their crops in the city of Beleco to a clientele of men and women. She would like to earn a profit of 120,000 FCFA per season.

loans.use: pay for plowing, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, hoeing, and equipment.

loans.name: A'zam

texts.ru: Аъзам 23-летний женатый молодой человек. У него один маленький ребенок. Он проживает в районе Хуросон с женой, ребенком, родителями и двумя братьями. Аъзам по натуре спокойный и добрый человек. Последние три года он занимается животноводческим бизнесом. В их семье все занимаются этим видом деятельности, ремесло передается им от поколения к поколению. Аъзам в основном разводит крупно-рогатый скот для продажи. Прибыль от животноводческой деятельности является единственным источником их семейного дохода. Аъзам просит кредит для закупа коров и телят, чтобы увеличить поголовье продаваемого скота. Его дальнейшие планы на будущее - расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: A'zam is a 23-year-old married man. He has one young child. He lives in the region of Khuroson with his wife, child, parents and two brothers. By nature, A'zam is a calm and kind person. For the last three years, he has been in the livestock business. In his family, everyone is involved in the business, with expertise being passed down from generation to generation. A'zam primarily raises cattle for sale. Profits from livestock sales are their family's only source of income. A'zam is applying for a loan to purchase cows and calves in order to increase the number of salable cattle. His long-term plan is to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: William

texts.en: Because of life's difficulties, William works hard to provide for the needs of his family. He has a farming business and cultivates rice. At the age of 56, he is off to the field at dawn, doing different farming activities just to make sure that his rice plants will grow healthy and he will be able to harvest more rice. Wanting to generate more income, William decided to avail a loan from Kiva lenders amounting to 28,000 Philippine pesos. If this loan is granted, he intends to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings. With this financial assistance, he believes that he will improve his farming business and he is hoping that he will increase his yield this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and pay the labor costs for transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 43 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like eggs, rice, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for six years.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like eggs, rice, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
This is Melencia, 53, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Melencia maintains a direct-selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct-selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are counting on as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

Melencia hopes to grow her business and have more branches. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Norol

texts.en:
Norol is 48 years old, married and has eight children, four of whom are in school. Norol is in an agricultural business farming vegetables and rice in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables and rice for eight years now and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Norol requested a 17,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries and purchase fertilizers and farm supplies. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her farming vegetable and rice business. In the future, Norol would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rose Marlene

texts.en:
Rose Marlene is 64 years old, and she is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rose Marlene has a vinegar processing business in the Philippines. Rose Marlene requested a 14000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Rose Marlene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rose Marlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel has a bodaboda (motorcycle) transport business. In addition, he operates a retail shop business which earns him another source of income. With this 50,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle and pay for maintenance costs. He decided to join Yehu to acquire financial services for his business growth.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and spare parts for his motorcycle and pay for maintenance costs.

loans.name: Diana Milagros

texts.es: Diana de 29 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Allí desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la actividad comercial, pues vende vestidos para damas, calzado, perfumería y artículos de aseo personal. Su idea de negocio la manifestó desde muy niña, pues le gustaba tener sus propios ingresos y así manejar su propio dinero. Por eso cuando fue adulta, viendo que una de sus amigas era exitosa y apoyaba los gastos de su familia con sus ingresos, desarrollando la actividad comercial,  decidió hacer lo mismo. Para iniciar su primo le prestó dinero, ella compró mercancía la distribuyó entre varios clientes y en términos de tres meses, le alcanzó para pagarle a su primo y obtener utilidades. Hoy en día se dedica al comercio de ropa, calzado femenino, bisutería etc. que son sus principales productos, con los que le va muy bien. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cua comprará sobre pedidos de sus mejores clientes, calzado, polvos faciales, cremas y perfumes, que exhiben sus catálogos, con  descuentos especiales. Con esta inversión impactará el bolsillo de sus clientes, pues ofrecerá buenos precios y este es justamente el éxito de su credikiva, porque su gran desafío era tener un capital de trabajo suficiente para responder a su demanda y hoy ya puede hacerlo, gracias a este credikiva. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local propio y genera mas ingresos para aumentar la calidad educativa de su hija, brindándole la oportunidad de estudiar en instituciones educativa de excelente calidad, potencializándole así su éxito futuro.
texts.en:
Diana is 29 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla with her husband and her small five-year-old daughter.  For 10 years she has been working in business, selling women’s dresses, footwear, perfume, and toiletries.  The idea to start a business came to her at a very young age because she liked having her own income and managing her own money. 

That’s why as an adult, when she saw that as a business woman one of her friends was successful and able to support her family with her income, Diana decided to do the same.  At first, her cousin lent her money.  She bought merchandise and sold it to several different customers.  In a matter of 3 months, she was able to pay her cousin back and make a profit. 

These days, she works selling her main products which are clothing, women’s footwear, and other miscellaneous items.  Her business is going very well.  She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first time financing through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to purchase personal orders at special discounts for her best customers.  She will buy footwear, facial powders, creams, and perfumes which are featured in her catalogues.  Such an investment will impact her customers’ pockets because she will be able to offer good prices.  Her Kiva loan will be successful precisely because her greatest challenge was finding enough capital to be able to respond to the demands of her customers, and now, thanks to Kiva, she will be able to do exactly that.   

Her goal for the future is to have her own storefront and to generate more income so that she can improve the quality of her daughter’s education.  By giving her daughter the opportunity to study in excellent educational institutions, she will strengthen her chance for success in the future.

loans.use: to buy personal orders, such as footwear, facial powders, creams, and perfumes for her best clients.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 26 years old. He lives in Borjomi district with his wife and 3-year-old daughter. Archil requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Archil is an artisan. He is manufacturing and fixing furniture. He works on private orders and gets a small monthly income, which is the only source of living for the family.

Archil requested a loan from Credo to start-up family business. Archil has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Archil will open a pub. He already has a commercial space, which needs some renovation jobs to be done. After renovation, Archil will purchase all the needed equipment and products and open a pub. Archil is a very hardworking man. He will work as hard as he can to make his business successful and profitable. He wants to expand the business and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: To open a pub.

loans.name: Julina

texts.en: Julina is a 22-year-old single mother from Talibon, Bohol. She has two young children. She engages in rice farming. She has been growing rice for almost two years. She requested a loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos to buy fertilizers, additional rice seedlings and medicines to increase her yield. In the future, Julina would like to expand her farming business to provide her children with good food and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, additional rice seedlings and medicines

loans.name: Masekesa Group

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 45-year-old Cecelia from Masvingo. She is widowed with one child. Cecelia runs a retail business selling clothes and vegetables. The business has been in operation for 23 years. She says the main challenge that she faces is that of the high transport costs of ferrying her goods from Harare. Cecelia has requested a loan of $600 to purchase clothes and vegetables for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her an increase in income, allowing her to buy building materials. In the future, Cecelia plans to build a shop in Save.

loans.use: to buy clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat to barbecue, spices, fish balls and hot dogs

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 23 years old and married, but has no children yet. He and his wife aim to become successful and financially stable in order to have a better life. Since farming is the main source of their income, Dickson plans to expand his rice farm to ensure a high production and yield. With that goal, Dickson wants to ask for a loan of 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) from Kiva lenders. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming. Through patience and hard work, he believes that he will be going to improve his farming business and increase his production this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides needed in rice farming.

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
This is Augustina. She previously accessed a 10,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her personal, household and business expenditures.

Augustina would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies and products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Augustina dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to help her children and grandchildren. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products, such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics, needed in her business.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic, 37, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marivic dreams to expand her business and hopes to give a good life to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
This is Maria. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities of chicken and pork to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a new 25,000 PHP loan for her to pay for chicken and pork that she needs in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Maria dreams to expand her business and to have a bright future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for chicken and pork for her business.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Rosie works hard to support her family.

She has a meat vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products. Rosie is borrowing 24,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional meat from pigs, chickens and cows to sell for her meat vending business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional meat from pigs, chickens and cows to sell.

loans.name: Gia

texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Gia lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his wife, Nana. Gia requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Gia’s wife is working at the local border office as an assistant on a small monthly salary. The family has recently opened a grocery shop. Gia is working in the shop himself to earn additional daily income for the family.

Gia requested a loan from Credo to start up the family business. Gia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Gia will purchase stock of groceries for his grocery shop. He wants to expand the varieties of products in his shop in order to satisfy clients' needs more. This will help him to attract more customers and make his business profitable. Part of the profit, he will reinvest in the same field, and another part will be used for the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase stock of groceries for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth. She previously accessed an 9,000 PHP loan that she used buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. Elizabeth would like to apply for another 9,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Profits from her business will help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Elizabeth hopes to expand her store. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Imeda

texts.en:
Imeda is a 43 years old man. He lives in the Lagodekhi District of Georgia, with his wife and 2 children. Imeda has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a vineyard and a plot of land, where maize is grown. They sell the harvested maize and wine locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for the family's food expenses. According to Credo estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Imeda has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Imeda has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Imeda will begin trading with fruits and vegetables. He plans to purchase a stock of fruits and vegetables, which will be transported by his minibus for resale at higher prices. This will help to increase the income of his family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Imeda's family.

loans.use: to begin trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a flour mixer

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
This is Erlinda, a 49-years-old woman and a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Redentor, a vendor and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating their business. They both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Erlinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day. She is requesting a Php10,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. Erlinda hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams to have good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 
All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is divorced and blessed with three children who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She cooks food for sale at the market, and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She cites theft as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future. With the Kshs 15,000 loan, Cecilia wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat

loans.name: Belal

texts.en: Belal, a 35-years-old married man and a father of three children. His wife currently works in the Ministry of Health when he decided to open his own business. Belal started his business by renting a small store and then turned it into a mini market to sell some basic food products and goods to the neighborhood. Now Belal has expanded by renting the store next door. Now he is seeking a loan to increase the quantity of goods he has to market as well as to add some variety in what he sells to satisfy all tastes of his customers.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of goods he has to market

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en: Emelita is 40 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Emelita is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock. Emelita has been raising livestock for the past 5 years, and also earns additional income from a general store and motorcycle transport business. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Ghazal

texts.en: Ghazal is 24-years-old hard working woman of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, two sons and a daughter. Her husband is a mobile technician and runs his own shop. Ghazal is very experienced and skilled woman. She has been selling bed sheets and cloth for the past 2 years. She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to purchase new varieties of bed sheets and cloths from other cities at lower rates and then sell it here for profit. She is living in a rented house and she wants to build her own house. This loan could help her to fulfill her dreams and she is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bed sheets

loans.name: Maysoon

texts.en: Maysoon is a 40-years-old married woman. She has three daughters and one son. Maysoon’s husband works in glass making and shaping. On the other hand, Maysoon does embroidery artwork and sometimes glass paintings. Now Maysoon is applying for a loan to get more fabric for her embroidery business as well as more colorful threads to make some fabric frames for her glass paintings.

loans.use: to get more fabric for her embroidery business as well as more colorful threads to make some fabric frames for her glass paintings.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 27 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rowena is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs. Rowena has been raising pigs for the past 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 53 years old and married with five children.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, like cream, coffee, noodles, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

Lucena has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Lucena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store, like cream, coffee, noodles, laundry soap, bath soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en: Maryam is a 53-year-old widow. She lives with her two sons and helps them by working at her mini-market, selling basic food products and a few types of detergents. Now Maryam is seeking a loan to increase the quantity and variety she has of goods in the store.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety she has of goods in the store.

loans.name: Najjera Twezimbe Women's Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a single mother of two children and runs a restaurant in a rural area. Both children attend a nearby school. She joined the business two years back so that she could be able to provide for her children all the basic needs, including education.

Through the group, she was able to get a loan even without collateral, which was her major hindrance. She therefore thanks the group members for standing with her in helping her grow her business. She wants the loan to pay for a stall in a busy place such that she can get more customers and therefore increase her income. She is a hardworking young woman.

loans.use: To pay for a stall in which she will run her restaurant.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
64-year-old retired Zurab lives in a small village of the Zestaponi district, Zvare with his retired wife. Zurab requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The family's only source of income is their own pensions, which in total is 195 Lari per month. This amount is rarely enough for the family's food expenses. 
Zurab requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Zurab has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Zurab will purchase a car to drive it as a taxi. Zurab wants to increase the family income and for this, he will drive locals around to earn a small daily income. The profit will be used for covering the food expenses and for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car and drive it as a taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for more stock of pizza as needed in her business.

loans.name: Abdulrahman

texts.en: Abdulrahman is a 36-years-old married man. He is a father of one son. Abdulrahman is the only working person in his family. He started a small business by opening a mini market and sell a few types of food ingredients and cans. Now he wants to improve his business by adding more types of food products for sale. For this, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to add more types of food products for sale

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 31 years old. He lives in the small village of Lagodekhi District with his wife, brother and pensioner parents. Gocha has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the family's income is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow tomatoes, watermelons and eggplants. They sell the harvested products at local markets. Besides this, Gocha has a tractor which is rented out seasonally. It is hardly enough for the family's food expenses. According to Credo estimations, his family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 
Gocha has requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Gocha has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit, Gocha will purchase a minibus. After the minibus is purchased, he will be able to begin trading with fruits and vegetables. This will help increase the income of their family. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of Gocha's family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus for trading fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Gulfam

texts.en: Gulfam is a 54-years-old hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and their 6 children. Her husband has been running a tire shop for the past 15 years. Gulfam has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. Her husband will purchase new tires for sale, and this would increase his net income and savings. Gulfam is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase new tires

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 29 años es una mujer activa y creativa, esta casada con el padre de sus 02 hijos de 13 y 07 años de edad respectivamente, juntos viven juntos en su casa propia.
Vilma se dedica a la venta de residuos de madera los cuales compra en grandes cantidades para luego distribuirlos entre los agricultores; este trabajo lo realiza en su casa ya que coloca los residuos de madea en costales de plástico para luego repartirlos ,lleva más de 05 años en esta actividad la cual lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo . Al principio le fue un poco complicado empezar ya que no tenia nada de conocimiento para este negocio, pero con el tiempo aprendió bastante y ahora tiene las pautas necesarias para poder tener contentos a sus clientes. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede utilizar el tiempo para realizar otras actividades, además cuando tiene un tiempo libre se va al mercado a vender algunos productos, sobre todo sabanas y colchas, tiene muchos clientes y esto le genera muy buenas ganancias. Este será su primer crédito con Kiva y esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para realizar este negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará residuos de madera al por mayor.
texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old and an active and creative woman.  She is married to the father of her two children, who are aged thirteen and seven years old each.  The family lives together in their privately owned home.

Vilma makes a living selling wood chips that she buys in bulk in order to sell to farmers.  She does this work from home as she stores the wood chips in large plastic bags.  Vilma has been doing this work for over five years and receives help from her husband.  In the beginning, this work was complicated as Vilma did not know anything about this kind of business but, with time, she has learned a lot and now has the necessary knowledge to keep her customers happy.  What Vilma likes about her work is that she can use her time to do other things as well.  In addition, when she has free time, Vilma goes to the market to sell other products, particularly bed sheets and bedspreads. She has many customers and this work generates a lot of profit.  This will be Vilma's first Kiva loan and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support to do this work.  Vilma will buy wood chips in bulk with this loan of 1500 Nuevo Soles.

loans.use: to buy wood chips in bulk.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, de 34 años de edad, esta casado con Yudy, quien es empleada y madre de su único hijo de 03 años , juntos viven en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Oscar es la construcción de viviendas por zona, pero como es muy  conocido a veces es solicitado en ciudades aledañas. Se inició hace más de 10 años, por iniciativa propia, ya que contaba con conocimientos necesarios para iniciarse en está actividad y necesitaba contar con sus propios ingresos para así no depender únicamente de una empresa. Por tanto, viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, está ahorrando sus ganancias pues desea en un futuro abrir una bodega de abarrotes para dar una mejor calidad  de vida a  sus hijos. Por tanto éste será su primer préstamo con Kiva y está agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para salir adelante. Con el monto solicitado de 4000 nuevos soles, comprará herramientas de construcción como martillos, combas, winchas, clavos , entre otros.
texts.en: Oscar is 34 years old and married to Yudy, who has a job and is mother to their only son, who is three years old.  This family lives together in their own privately owned house.  Oscar makes a living building homes in the local area.  However, because he is very well-known, sometimes people ask him to work in neighbouring cities.  Oscar started this business with his own initiative over ten years ago, as he already had the necessary knowledge to do it.  He needed also to be able to have his own income so that he did not have to rely solely on another business.  So, seeing his good results, Oscar is saving his profits as, in the future, he would like to open a grocery store so as to provide his children with a better quality of living.  This will be Oscar's first loan with Kiva and he is very grateful for the financial support that he is receiving in order to get ahead.  Oscar will buy building tools such as hammers, measuring tapes, sledgehammers and more with this loan of 4000 Nuevo Soles.

loans.use: to buy building tools such as hammers, measuring tapes, sledgehammers and more.

loans.name: Bethel Group

texts.es:
La señora Tereza de estado civil unida de hecho, de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hijos y los dos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos, inició este negocio con un pequeño capital que le dio su esposo y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de pollos para criarlos y luego venderlos, en el futuro desea tener una granja grande con varios animales para poder venderlos en el mercado y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican al comercio, crianza de animales y elaboracion de guipiles tipicos.
texts.en:
Tereza, 54, has a common-law husband and two children in school, although she was unable to get an education herself.  She has a business raising chickens that she began with a small amount of money that she received from her husband.  So far, she has been in business for ten years.

She has organized a group and is requesting a loan to buy chickens to raise and sell.  In the future she would like to have a large farm with many animals to sell at the market and increase her income.  

The other members of the group are involved in sales, livestock farming and traditional costume making.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: La Laguneta Group

texts.es:
El señor Alfonso su estado civil es unido de hecho, de edad 35 años, curso 3 años de educación primaria, tiene 3 hijos y 1 de ellos esta estudiando, él se dedica a la agricultura cultiva Café, inició este negocio con un pequeño ahorro que tenia y compro unas plantitas de café y hasta la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de fertilizante para su cultivo de café y en el futuro desea tener una plantación más grande de café y tener abundantes cosechas; los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a agricultura siembran maíz, café y frijol.
texts.en:
Alfonso, 35, has a common-law wife and three children, one of which is in school; and he himself has a third grade education.  Alfonso grows coffee for a living and began his business with a small amount of savings that he used to buy a few coffee plants.  He has ten years' experience to date.

He decided to organize a group and request a loan to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.  In the future he would like to have a larger coffee plantation and abundant harvests.  The other members of the group are farmers who grow corn, coffee and beans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Terminal Vii Group

texts.es:
La señora Blanca Esther es soltera, de edad 23 años, curso los 6 años de educación secundaria, ella tiene un comedor, inició este negocio con su padre y hasta la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia.

Decide organizar un grupo y asi poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de insumos tales como: azucar, café, granos basicos, entre otros, en el futuro desea contar con un capital mayor y asi poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a vender comida, venta de ropa y tieneda de consumo diario.
texts.en:
Blanca Esther, 23, is single and has a sixth grade education.  She runs a diner that she started with her father four years ago and operates with the support of her family.

She decided to organize a group in order to request a loan to buy supplies such as sugar, coffee, basic staples, etc.  In the future she hopes to have more capital so she can continuing satisfying her customers' needs.  The other members of the group sell food, clothing and run a convenience store.

loans.use: To buy diner supplies.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 27-year-old man from Obunga in the city of Kisumu; he is married to Salome, who is also a business woman and supports the family. He supports two people in his family; he has one child who is five years old.

He makes fertilizers for small scale farmers; it is a business that he has been doing for the last six years. Erick makes a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more raw materials for making fertilizers. He will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

He has hopes of expanding his business and to be in a position to support his family.

loans.use: To add more stock of molasses.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es: La Sra. Danitza tiene 30 años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 11, 7 y 3 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano,  en su puesto de venta que se encuentran en la populosa feria de la  16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto,  este préstamo es su  primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Danitza va a usar este préstamo para la compra de fardos de ropa de segunda mano para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital, la  Sra. Danitza enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay muchas personas que se dedican a esta actividad por la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su puesto de venta, su deseo para su negocio tener mercadería surtida para ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientes, la  Sra. Danitza es una persona trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
Danitza, 30, is married and has three children, ages 11, 7 and 3.  She has a used clothing stall at the busy "16 de Julio" Market in the city of el Alto.  This loan is her first through the institution and Danitza plans to use it to buy bulk used clothing for her business.  She is requesting the loan due to her lack of capital.  Danitza has a lot of competition in the area because many people are in the same business.

She will use the profits she earns to continue fixing up her stall.  She eventually wants to have a wide variety of stock to offer her customers.  Danitza is a very hard worker and is happy and grateful to the institution for this support which will allow her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy bulk clothing.

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en: Sameh is 22 years old, and a resident of Taiz, Yemen. He mentions that he has been involved in selling cosmetics and perfumes for five years. His parents taught him how to develop in this business. There is a lot of activity in his area, as far as all types of arts and crafts are concerned. Because of his good customer skills, he is able to attract more clients. He would like to expand his business. So, he took out a youth loan of 200,000 YER to stock his business with cosmetics, ladies' handbags and perfumes. He wishes to open additional business in same field.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, ladies' handbags, and perfumes for his business.

loans.name: Monica Gladys

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica tiene 23 años,  casada con 1 hijos que tiene la edad de una  año,  la Sra. Mónica se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de higiene y limpieza como champó jabón, jaboncillos, peines y toallas y variedad de artículos en su puesto de venta  que se encuentra ubicado en una de las zonas más concurridas  de la ciudad de El Alto, ella es cliente que se encuentra en su primer ciclo dentro de la institución, la Sra. Mónica va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de artículos de limpieza para surtir su negocio y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Mónica va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mónica, 23, is married and has a one-year-old child.  She sells personal care and cleaning products, such as shampoo, soap, combs, towels and a variety of items at the stall she has in one of the busiest areas of the city of El Alto.  This is her first loan through the institution and she plans to use it to buy a variety of cleaning products to stock her business.  This will allow her to offer her customers a wider range of products.

Mónica has requested the loan so she can continue improving her business.  She will use the profits to continue buying products and improving her income.

loans.use: To buy a variety of cleaning products.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is a 52-year-old gentleman. He is married and the father of four children between the ages of 24 and 13 years. He has been operating a hardware shop for the last three years and has a monthly income of KES 45,000.

Jason got to learn about KADET LTD from his wife's colleague, who is a registered member. He has acquired a fourth loan of KES 35,000, which will facilitate him in hiring staff to manage the hardware business as he focuses on opening another branch.

Proceeds from the business will be plowed back into it for expansion. His dream is to expand the business into a large venture that serves the entire county.

loans.use: to employ extra staff in his hardware business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: While her husband works as a carpenter, Edna is very happy managing her hog-raising business. Aside from that, Edna sometimes cooks food and sells it in their village as an extra source of income. The couple already has a child whom they really love. According to them, they are working double time to provide for the needs of their child. Edna desires to generate more income; thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy feed for her hogs. She believes that with sufficient feed, her hogs will grow healthy, which will result in a higher income.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and one daughter. She has been doing the business of selling school bags for the past 13 years. Her sales are increasing with time. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. She would like to purchase a new variety of school bags so that her sales and net income will increase. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC. Kalsoom is raising her hand in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase school bags for her retail business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct-selling Avon products business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers. Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita earns more income from her motorcycle transport business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of Avon products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is forty years old and married to John. She is the mother of three children. She rears chickens and she has been in the business for the last five years; she makes a monthly income of KES 25,000.

She learned about LTD from some women in the market. She has been issued a second loan of KES 40,000 after successfully repaying her previous loan. The funds will be used to purchase poultry feed as well as buy additional chicks. The proceeds will facilitate the expansion of the chicken house.

Virginia hopes to generate enough income to establish a hair saloon.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and buy more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en: Samreen is a 30-year-old woman. Her husband is running a business of selling gem stones for the past 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Samreen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would increase. After getting the profit, Samreen would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: to buy rare gem stones to sell.

loans.name: Maria Maribel

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 27 años de edad con un grado de educación cursado hasta sexto de primaria que en compañía de su esposo trabajan la agricultura en lo que el cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Ellos tienen 4 hijos dos están en la escuela, uno en el kínder y último aún está bien pequeño. Ella se dedica a la agricultura en lo que es el cultivo de café hace más de 8 años actividad aprendida de su padres que han sido agricultores toda la vida y sus actividades económicas son el cultivo de maíz y frijoles. Las tierras que ella en compañía de su pareja cultiva las han adquirido gracias al esfuerzo, trabajo y dedicación para tener lo propio las cuales están ubicadas a una distancia de un kilómetro a la cual se trasladan a pie.

María actualmente solicita ayuda para la compra de fertilizante, abono entro otros insumos para dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café los cuales son su único medio de ingreso familiar.

Sus planes a futuro es comprar más parcelas de tierra para seguir cultivando y su sueño como madre es ver a sus hijos en mejores condiciones de vida y que tengan la oportunidad de estudiar para que el día de mañana sean mejores.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old and completed up to the end of sixth grade at primary school.  María works in farming, growing beans and corn, alongside her husband.  The couple has four children, two of whom are in school; one is at nursery and the youngest is not yet old enough for school.  María has been working in farming and growing coffee for over eight years.  She learned this trade from her parents, who were farmers all their lives.  They earned a living growing corn and beans.  María bought her land after a lot of effort, hard work and dedication.  The plot is a kilometre from the family home and María and her husband arrive there by foot.  

María is currently applying for a loan in order to buy fertiliser, manure and other supplies to maintain her coffee plants, which are her only source of income to support the family.

María's future plan is to buy more plots of land so as to continue to grow crops.  As a mother, her dream is to see her children have better living conditions and for the them to have more opportunities so that, later, they can be better off.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Iii Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le arachide  avec NYELE , 2 eme debout de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 20.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
